results.title: The International Court of Justice
results.creator_credit: Karl Van der Ploeg, Janine Hamel-Minne and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: The origin of the concept of international law and the evolvement of the role of the International Court of Justice in the Hague, in deciding legal disputes between States. Its work and function are illustrated in the controversy between Norway and the United Kingdom concerning fishing rights, the disputed frontier land between Belgium and the Netherlands, and the dispute between Cambodia and Thailand regarding the territorial sovereignty of a holy monastery.

results.title: Indonesia: an Alternative Lifestyle
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film that contrasts behind-the-scenes life in both rural and urban Indonesia with the view of the country as seen by foreign tourists.

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Mark McDonald, Walter Batty, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.

results.title: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

video_links.name: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

results.brief_description: Shows how the three aims of controlled irrigation can be achieved in furrow irrigation by putting the “correct flow” down the furrows so as to obtain even distribution of the water over the whole area and down to the depth of the root zone. The various factors which determine “correct flow” are briefly considered and finally the method whereby it may be obtained and checked is outlined.

results.title: The Story of Holmesglen Concrete Housing Project
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Housing Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Housing Commission of Victoria has a huge project at Holmesglen, a suburb of Melbourne, for the manufacture of prefabricated houses. All components of a modern house or a block of flats are constructed at this factory and transported in bulk to the place of erection. Concrete walls, chimneys, fences, tiles for roofs, plumbing units, wooden door cupboards and other fittings are all shown under construction and are then shown being fitted into place as the house is erected. Credit is given to the research work being carried out by the CSIRO Building Research Division, particularly in regard to a new type of light weight concrete which has been developed there.

results.title: Holiday album
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Snapshots from a family holiday album show tourist attractions throughout Victoria: recreation in the metropolitan area; winter sports at Mt Buffalo; springtime in the Grampians; a leisurely journey down the Murray in the paddle-steamer “Coonawarra”; sailing and fishing at Lakes Entrance; forest country at Marysville; the beaches along the Great Ocean Road. Commentary by Robert Peach.

results.title: Handle with care: glass
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Indian glass industry, contrasting the products of the individual artisan and the modern streamlined factory. To aid the industry, the Government established the Central Glass and ceramic Research Institute in Calcutta to conduct research into new types of glass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Gunpowder Man
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Eastern Suburb's Children's Film Group
results.brief_description:
In this short film, made in 1966, two children build a Guy Fawkes statue, but are spotted by a third child who reveals their secret to their classmates. The children fight over the statue and eventually join forces to light the bonfire together.

The burning of a Guy Fawkes effigy is a tradition that emerged in the UK, initially to commemorate the failure of a plot, known as the Gunpowder Plot, to assassinate King James I in London on 5 November 1605. In its modern form, the tradition is celebrated as more of a social gathering, with a display of bonfires and fireworks. In Australia, it has become less common since the 1970s.

This short film was sponsored by the Eastern Suburbs Children’s Film Group, Melbourne, and produced and directed by John Richardson. Written by John Richardson and Val Fairweather. Featured cast include Christopher Wilson, Scott McClung, Christopher Ely, Robert Bartnik, Ian Mathieson, Daniel Meltzer, Stephen Palamountain and Jamie Steuart.

results.title: Community College Mt Gambier: growing
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the story of the South East Community College Mount Gambier. Features two teachers, Bev Puckridge and Ian Winter, who narrate throughout the film. Shows how students go back to their own communities and set up and teach smaller groups in woodwork, pottery, spinning etc. Emphasis is made that art is a natural part of our world - a natural thing to do. It is not the finished product that really matters, but the thought process used to achieve it.
